title: Duplicate pushnotifications

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
### Describe the bug
For some reason there are multiple event start reminder scheduled pushnotifications for some events. My best guess is something wemt wrong in the migrations from when I refactored them. 

We'll need to look in a shell on production to see if that's the case. Probably some ScheduledMessages have then been orphaned (arent EventStartReminder, and hence don't have an Event linked. That would explain why some have an outdated time). In that case, we can just drop those.

title: Fix event cancellation and other mail improvements

labels.name: chore
labels.description: Something that is not a bug or a feature, does not change production behaviour

body:
Closes #2964 and does some code cleanup

<!--

Please add the appropriate label for the change that you made to this PR:
- feature: new feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
- bug: fix for the user, not a fix to a build script
- docs: changes to the documentation
- refactor: refactoring production code, eg. renaming a variable or rewriting a function
- test: adding missing tests, refactoring tests; no production code change
- chore: updating poetry, changing the CI settings etc; no production code change

-->

### Summary
- Event emails (about late event cancellation etc) now uses contact_address instead of contact_mailinglist so that all member groups can now be reached. This also means no None checking is necessary because this field is always true: we verify in `clean()` that there is either a mailinglist or an address.
- Remove check for organisers without contact mailing list because we can now also mail the contact address.
- Remove some duplicate code in the admin, which does change shown email addresses on staging and localhost
- The `committees` and `societies` mailinglists now include membergroups with contact_email rather than contact_mailinglist set.

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
1. Create an event with some organisers that do not have a mailing list associated with them, and cancellation notifications enabled.
2. Observe that you can now cancel from this event, unlike before.
3. Also observe that committees and societies still have correct email addresses in the admin list display. (Note that thalia.nu may be replaced by thalia.localhost, this is because it uses the SITE_DOMAIN.)
4. Somehow check that the mailinglist integration still reports the correct email addresses. I am not sure how to do this (@JobDoesburg do you maybe know this?)

title: Thabloid preview is broken

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

labels.name: request-for-comments
labels.description: Author wants to have other people respond for their opinion

body:
### Describe the bug
The preview of thabloids does not work since S3:
- https://thalia.nu/members/thabloid/pages/2022/3/ returns `[]` (see https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/blob/ce784be158c2e26afa9d389d67065db1cb1a716c/website/thabloid/models.py#L82)
- The 'pages' idea of thabloid is in general pretty broken. It seems like pages are getting created when requesting https://thalia.nu/members/thabloid/ because it's incredibly slow.

### How to reproduce
Open https://thalia.nu/members/thabloid/.


It's probably a good idea to rework the thabloid saving logic quite thoroughly. It might be good to add a `ThabloidPage` model just to keep track of the files that are being created more clearly.
 
The hacky ghostscript used to thumbnail the pages is quite ugly anyway. So personally I wouldn't mind dropping the page viewer alltogether. Then we still need to get the frontpages somehow for the cover, but it would be great if we can get rid of ghostscript entirely.

title: Implement rate-limiting for password-forgot

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
There is no rate-limiting on the password-forgot view. It is thus possible to spam a user with known emailadress with a lot of password reset emails and perform some kind of DoS.

Also note that for password-forgot, we use uuid's, which are not secure! We should implement secure secret tokens.

### How to reproduce


### Expected behaviour
Check if a password reset token was sent in the past x minutes. 

### Screenshots

### Additional context
We were notified about this via responsible disclosure (the rate-limiting, not the uuid part)

title: Fix request.member evaluated too early in API calls

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
### Summary
Fixes a problem (introduced in #2734) where the API calls cannot access `request.member` when authenticated with oauth only. See e.g. https://thalia.sentry.io/issues/3952946075/?project=1463433&query=is%3Aunresolved&referrer=issue-stream where this leads to a 500. In other cases, APIs currently would simply return wrong results.

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
1. Make an API call that would use request.member, but without session authentication (i.e. not from the swagger client, unless you remove the sessionid after authenticating it with oauth).
For example `http 127.0.0.1:8000/api/v2/payments/ authorization:"Bearer <insert a token here>" -h`

title: Summary download not working

labels.name: priority: medium

body:
### Describe the bug
Some summaries (for example Data Mining 2019-2020 Practice Exam Midterms) are not downloaded when clicked. They also do not work when trying to view them through the Site Administration. Pressing these buttons only leads to a new empty tab. 

Some summaries still work however.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to 'education'
2. Scroll down to 'data mining'
3. Click on 'data mining'
4. Click on '2019-2020'
5. Click on 'Practice Exam Midterm'

### Expected behaviour
Clicking this button should download the associated file.

### Describe the bug
When adding an event to the site the window, which pops up when you select a date or a time, appears underneath the text styling bar of the description. The z index of the description text styling bar should be lower then that of the time/date selection window.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to 'thalia.nu/admin'
2. Click on 'events'
3. Click on add event
4. Go to details

7. See error

### Expected behaviour
 The z index of the description text styling bar should be lower then that of the time/date selection window.

### Screenshots

title: Under-age people can pay for age restricted orders through API

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
When an under-age person tries to pay for an age-restricted order, they are set as the `payer`. Although the website won't show a 'pay with thalia pay' button, and thadmin will warn its user, it is still possible for the payer to create a payment with the API.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Create an age-restricted order.
2. Be signed in as a minor.
3. Open the payment url.
4. Observe that you are not allowed to pay.
5. PATCH `api/v2/payments/sales/order/<order uuid>/`
6. Observe that you have now created a payment.

### Expected behaviour
The API endpoint should give 403.


I haven't checked how thadmin handles this. I hope it will keep showing the under-age warning, but it might be that once a payment is made the 'paid' state overrules the 'under-age' state.

title: Make price serializers match PaymentAmountField
body:
@TippieCodes ran into an issue with the API crashing on serializing certain fields, apparently a bogus high fine.

I found out that this is because the serializer has a lower `max_digits` than `PaymentAmountField`.

I fixed this both for fines, and the other `DecimalField` serializers I could find that were related to `PaymentAmountField`s.

title: TinyMCE editor shows superfluous markup options

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
PR #2201 changed the TinyMCE settings to include a whole toolbar. And I am not sure why, because we had a carefully selected list of options available. 

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to a page with a TinyMCE HTMLField (that works and is not broken)
2. Note that the toolbar contains a thousand options.

### Expected behaviour
The toolbar should only contain a really small subset of HTML options.

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Additional context
We have deliberately chosen for a subset of HTML options in the past because we don't want anyone using the website actually inserting any fancy styles at all. This is for multiple reasons:
 - People within Thalia do crazy stuff, like fill a description with tables and images instead of readable text that also works on the frontpage, on mobile and in the app.
 - Some HTML tags do not have proper styling, like quotes and some of the header styles
 - In some of the HTML editor situations we cannot even support some of the styles, like in the newsletter. Since it needs inline styling on all elements we want the input (which is directly taken from the events) to be as basic as possible.

Some of this behaviour is also enforced by [our bleach configuration](https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/blob/master/website/thaliawebsite/templatetags/bleach_tags.py). Some of the options available in the toolbar after this change will just be filtered out and are thus there for no reason.

title: Add global uniqueness constraint on push notification tokens

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
### Describe the bug
Currently, in a `Device`, the combination of `user` and `registration_id` (a Firebase Messaging token) is unique. This means that it's possible for one token to be used by multiple users. This makes it possible for one device to receive notifications intended for multiple users. For example.

Alice has registered a device with token `a`. Bob also registers a device with token `a` (although he doesn't have a device that receives from token `a`). Alice now receives push notifications that are sent only to Bob. 

It's quite unlikely that this would ever happen (Bob would need to read Alice's token from the admin and then use it in a device), and even then it would still only mean that Alice receives wrong notifications, but I think this should just be made impossible in the code as it is not logical behaviour.

https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/blob/3dceb39fe0e0d251c0e8a81393d40d1ad6b564e2/website/pushnotifications/models.py#L68-L72

title: Price of events in newsletter cannot be 0.00

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
### Describe the bug
When adding events to the newsletters that are free, the price and costs will automatically become 0.00. When I then try to save the newsletter, it gives an error saying that these two fields cannot be 0.00. I manually have to clear them in order to save the newsletter.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to 'Newsletters'
2. Click on 'Add newsletter'
3. Scroll down to 'Newsletter events'
4. Click on 'Add new newsletter event'
5. Add event that does not cost anything
6. Save the newsletter

### Expected behaviour
Two possibilities:
- The newsletter must be able to cope with events that have a price and cost of 0.00, by just removing the price or showing a price of €0.00 in the actual newsletter.
- If an event is free, keep the fields of price and cost empty, when adding an event to the newsletter.

### Screenshots
-

-

title: Payment amount seems to have max value of 99.99

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

labels.name: chore
labels.description: Something that is not a bug or a feature, does not change production behaviour

body:
### Describe the change
https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/pull/2086#issuecomment-995261018 suggests that on production database systems, the maximum value for payment amount is 99.99... This is intended to be 9999.99, though... This should be verified and possibly fixed

### Motivation
99.99 is high, but not uncommonly high for payments

### Current implementation
We use DecimalFields with 6 digits and 2 decimals. But apparently that does not work properly?

### Suggested implementation
- Verify existence of the issue
- Perhaps, subclass DecimalField ourselves to some payment amount field, that auto-sets the number of digits and decimals.

### Additional context

title: General meeting documents are not private

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
### Describe the bug
The documents that were discussed during a general meeting are publicly available. This behaviour is inconsistent, because the minutes, policy documents and annual reports are private and require authentication.

For example, you need to authenticate to download the minutes of the general meeting of 16-06-2021 (document 483). But you do not need to authenticate to download the file "Minutes 16-06-2021" (document 481) that is part of the set of documents that was discussed during the general meeting of 13-10-2021.

### How to reproduce
1. Go to the [documents page](https://thalia.nu/association/documents/).
2. Copy the download link of the minutes of the general meeting of 16-06-2021 (the pink "MINUTES" button) into a private browsing session.
3. Observe that you are redirected to a login page.
4. Copy the download link of the second document that was discussed during the general meeting of 13-10-2021 (called "Minutes 16-06-2021") into a private browsing session.
5. Observe that you download the file.

### Expected behaviour
All documents under the header "annual documents" require authentication.

title: Disable pizza button when ordering isn't possible yet. Hide it when the event is far in the past
body:
Closes #1928 

<!--

Please add the appropriate label for the change that you made to this PR:
- feature: new feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
- bug: fix for the user, not a fix to a build script
- docs: changes to the documentation
- refactor: refactoring production code, eg. renaming a variable or rewriting a function
- test: adding missing tests, refactoring tests; no production code change
- chore: updating poetry, changing the CI settings etc; no production code change

-->

### Summary
Changed when the pizza order button is shown in event. There are 3 possibilities:
1. You can currently order pizza for this event, or the pizza event for this event 'just ended', so it ended in the last 8 hours. Then the pizza button is shown.
2. Between now and the pizza event associated with the event there is another pizza event. Then it disabled the button and shows the text: "Ordering pizza for this event isn't possible yet"
3. The pizza event is long past. Then it hides the pizza button entirely.

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
To test situation 1:
- Make an event with a pizza event 
- Check if you see the button
- Make it so the pizza event ended in the last 8 hours
- Check if you still see the button
Situation 2:
- Add another event with a pizza event in the future
- Check that on that event page the pizza button is disabled
Situation 3:
- Make an event with a pizza event long in the past
- Check that the pizza button is hidden

title: Hide pizza order button if ordering for event is not possible

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

labels.name: style
labels.description: Issues regarding stylesheets, ui and layout stuff

body:
### Describe the bug
Pizza order allowed for other event that you are not registered for. If someone registers for a later event that they cannot yet order pizza for, they can order pizza for an event that does allow ordering of pizza.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Register for event with pizza 2, where event 2 has not opened their order window
2. Order pizza for event with pizza 1, where event 1 has opened their order window
3. Pizza gets delivered to pizza event 1
4. Person is not there at event 1 but pizza is in the order list for that event.

### Expected behaviour
People not registered for an event should not be able to order pizza for said event.

### Additional context
This loses Thalia money, as pizza's get ordered that are not paid for.

title: Remove cache from payable registry
body:
Closes #1865

### Summary
The payable registry could use old data when querying a payable while a payment was deleted for that object. This lead to weird behavior.

### How to test
Previously:

1. Have a payable object, for example an event registration
2. Add a payment for it (write down the uuid and created_at if you want to see something funny)
3. Delete the payment
4. Inspect that the payment is really really deleted
5. Re-create a payment
6. The same payment with the same uuid and created_at re-appears in the database 🤯 

Now:

1. Have a payable object, for example an event registration
2. Add a payment for it
3. Delete the payment
4. Re-create the payment
5. The payment is re-created and has a different uuid and created_at field

Also:

1. Have a payable object, for example an event registration
2. Add a payment for it
3. Delete the payment
4. Trying to re-create the payment via API will not give errors saying that it is already paid!

title: Event permissions.can_cancel_registration when paid

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
The can_cancel_registration permission is sometimes true when a registration is already paid and thus cannot be cancelled.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Pay for an event registration.
2. can_cancel_registration is true (check in api).
3. Cancel the registration.
4. It fails.

### Expected behaviour
The permission is false when the registration is paid and the payment can't be deleted.

title: Fix payable registry cache using old data

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

labels.name: test
labels.description: Adding missing tests, refactoring tests; no production code change

body:
### Describe the bug
Payments are a mess. For example, if you pay for an event registration, delete the payment (through the admin or api), creating a new TPay payment through the api fails with 409 Conflict, there is still a payment in the registration model, but not in the payments api. Furthermore, paying with a different payment type works, but those payments can then not be removed. Also see #1806. I suspect there are many more related problems.

### How to reproduce
Play around with payable things, deleting and recreating them, or deleting and recreating payments.

### Expected behaviour
When a payable is not paid and should be payable with TPay, paying does not fail. Deleting a payment makes the payable not-paid as it was before creating the payment. Deleting or changing a payable is either impossible, or also deletes a payment that belongs to it.

### Additional context
I think it would be a good idea to combine this with #1000. Some test-driven development would make sense for payments, and I think the expected behaviour should be well-testable. Of course the problems may not be entirely within the payments app, but also in the payables defined by other apps.

title: Cannot cancel paid food order in API

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
### Describe the bug
It is not possible to cancel a foodOrder paid with Thalia Pay with a DELETE request in API v2, but it is possible to first change it to a different product, which deletes the payment, and then cancel it when it is not paid.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Order a pizza
2. Pay with TPay
3. Try to cancel through api v2
4. You can't
5. Change the order

title: PaymentDetailView in admin API allows deleting payments unauthorized

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/blob/4ab37961f50e398cc52422cdc1df66f6ab8ff2ee/website/payments/api/v2/admin/views.py#L69

### Describe the bug
Payments sometimes should be undeletable. For example, TPay payments that are in a batch. The PaymentAdmin prevents such deletions. However, the rest framework DestroyAPIView does not respect that.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Have a payment 
2. Add it to a batch
3. Process the batch
4. Do the API `DELETE` request at `/api/v2/admin/payments/<id>`

### Expected behaviour
Either disable payment deletion at all from the API, or manually implement a check that the payment is not in a processed batch.

title: Cannot renew membership as benefactor, expects length field

labels.name: priority: high

body:
### Describe the bug
Right now, when trying to renew a membership as benefactor from http://localhost:8000/user/membership/ I can't send the form. I get a javascript error: `An invalid form control with name='length' is not focusable.` 
So the problem is that the length field is expected to have a value while this isn't the case for benefactors.

It should ignore the length field for benefactorship renewals, as for benefactors it is always 1 year

title: Fix username uniqueness
body:
Closes #945 

### Summary
This PR does 2 things related to the problem in #945:

1. It prevents the bug from occurring in some cases, by making sure that it is not possible to save registrations that share the username with other registrations (even when they are not completed yet)
2. When the bug still occurs, the payment is deleted so that we will never end up in the situation that a registration is paid but not accepted.
3. In all these cases, the payment button admin view will show an error to the user

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
1. Create a registration
2. Approve it, etc.
3. Set the username to a different user's username 
4. That should fail
5. Set the username to the username of a different accepted registration
6. That should fail as well
7. Secretly force override the username value by manually inserting it in the database. Choose a username of a user that already exists
8. Paying will fail and result in an error shown to the user. The payment will be deleted / not be created and the entry will be 'ready for review' again.

title: Make membership ManyToOne instead of OneToOne
body:
Closes #962

### Summary
If a user renews their membership for the second time in the same year (because you do a study-length renewal after a regular renewal), the site would crash after payment, as there would be 2 renewals pointing to the same membership object. This PR fixes that and I think that this is by far the easiest and cleanest solution to the problem.

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:

1. Do a renewal for 1 year
2. Approve it, add a payment, finish it fully etc
3. Do a renewal for the rest of your study
4. Approve it
5. Process a payment
6. No breakage

title: Use distinct queryset in PaymentUserAdmin
body:
### Summary
On certain sql systems, querying for whether a bank account exists (in the `tpay_enabled` `queryable-property`) could duplicate the entries, because in the backend a Cartesian product of the two tables was computed. This PR introduces a different way of counting bank accounts that are valid that does not have this problem

### How to test
1. Have a user
2. Make it have 2 bank accounts used for Thalia Pay (one active, one inactive)
3. Check out the PaymentUserAdmin
4. It should contain that user just once (and ignore the old inactive bank account)

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
Our current index (front) page does not have a block to show messages (warnings/errors/success messages). This will have the consequence that the messages are displayed at the first new page that is able to show messages. This can lead to weird behavior, like payment confirmations suddenly showing up.


### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Trigger a message to the user (for example confirm a Thalia Pay payment)
2. Redirect yourself to the index page
3. No message appears
4. Visit the admin
5. The admin is displayed right now

### Expected behaviour
Every page that uses our base template should be capable of displaying messages.

title: Change mandate no. increment to guarantee uniqueness

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
Consider https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/blob/56ef628318d5bc4c4bbdc28a6eeac2d6c73cc218/website/payments/views.py#L44

In case an admin might manually remove a mandate (rather than invalidate it), manually change a user's mandate id, the newly generated mandate id might not always be unique. For example, if a user has mandate no. 1234-1 and 1234-3, the next number that will be generated is 1234-3 as well (because we take the `count() + 1`).

Solution: take the max mandate no. if it is of the form `<id>-<i>`, the new mandate no. will be `<id>-<i+1>`, else use the fallback we have already implemented. 

Other solution: do an additional check that the newly generated reference number is in fact really unique.

title: Encoding problem in Thalia Pay withdrawal notice

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
The payment description in the Thalia Pay withdrawal notice e-mails has some encoding problems. For example, `EVC's Xmas Xtravaganza` is displayed as `EVC's Xmas Xtravaganza`. It is shown correctly in the 'my payments' overview.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Create a payment with special characters in the topic
2. Add to batch
3. Send withdrawal notice
4. Check how the mail renders

### Expected behaviour
Text is displayed correctly

title: Rename --preset to --primary and fix the grid overlay RGBA background
body:
### Summary

This PR does four things: 
1. It renames the primary CSS colour variable from `--preset` to `--primary` to bring it in line with the fact that we have a secondary colour.
2. It removes all duplicate variables from the dark mode variables
3. The variables document is now properly formatted with 4 spaces
3. It fixes an issue with the usage of the primary colour in a rgba function

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
1. Setup a review environment
2. Check that the colours are still correct
3. Check that the overlay has a background again by going to a page with the grid structure (for example photos, members or documents) and hover over an item.

title: Cannot add Partner postal code of another country

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
I felt like this was in between a feature request and bug, but decided to make it a bug report since this bugs me.
When adding/editing a Partner in the site administration, the company address only accepts valid postal codes from the Netherlands (1234AB). We have a new partner ([https://thalia.nu/career/partners/exellys/](https://thalia.nu/career/partners/exellys/)) that only has offices in Belgium and has a postal code of 2800, and the form rejects this, so I had to settle with 2800ME instead (it's in Mechelen). It would be nice if the postal code was less strict, which shouldn't cause too many issues, since the little Google Maps location already looks fine if I use the incorrect 2800ME but add the correct country to the city.

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to 'Partners' in Site administration, and add/edit a partner.
2. Fill in required information, and set postal code to 2800 (or sth else). In this example, I set "City" to "Mechelen, Belgium".
3. Click any save button.
4. Input is rejected.

### Expected behaviour
I would hope for it to not reject the postal code.

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6312298/96731400-836f8980-13b7-11eb-9c7a-a20100e0b034.png)

title: Save newsletter to disk when sending
body:
Closes #1291  

<!--

Please add the appropriate label for the change that you made to this PR:
- feature: new feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
- bug: fix for the user, not a fix to a build script
- docs: changes to the documentation
- refactor: refactoring production code, eg. renaming a variable or rewriting a function
- test: adding missing tests, refactoring tests; no production code change
- chore: updating poetry, changing the CI settings etc; no production code change

-->

### Summary
The newsletter was saved by the email sending code which for some reason doesn't actually work. The newsletter is now saved by the newsletter services itself, which does work.

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
1. Create a newsletter
2. Send it to the members
3. Notice that the newsletter got saved to disk

title: Newsletter HTML is not saved when sending

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug

Newsletter HTML is not saved when sending

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Create a newsletter
2. Send it
3. An HTML file should be saved to the media folder
4. But your newsletter is not there

### Expected behaviour

There should be an HTML file saved upon sending the newsletter. This HTML is the state of the newsletter when sending, which retains the original layout used. So if we ever change the newsletter generator we do not lose the original newsletters the way they were sent.

title: create fixtures crashes on "django.db.utils.IntegrityError: UNIQUE constraint failed: activemembers_membergroup.name"

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
When running `./manage.py createfixtures`, it crashes on the following error: `django.db.utils.IntegrityError: UNIQUE constraint failed: activemembers_membergroup.name`

### How to reproduce
Run `./manage.py createfixtures`

### Expected behaviour
Not crash

### Additional context
The reason this bug occurs, seems to be that after removing localization, we are using `member_group.name` instead of `name_en` in the database. However, this is not fixed in the `createfixtures` code.

title: Do not create payment when payment status is not changed
body:
Closes #1198

### Summary

When only the present value changes in the API but not the status of the payment we should not create a payment object.

### How to test
Steps to test the changes you made:
1. Create an event with registrations
2. Register
3. Mark the registration as present _in the app_
You can simulate this by going to the registration using the API on `/v1/api/registrations/` and patching the body:
```
{
    "payment": "no_payment",
    "present": true
}
```
4. Note that a payment with the status 'no payment' is not created for this registration like it is supposed to

### Notes

I have included a slightly different version on the `release/32` branch so that we can release this with messy cherry-picks. It is included in the [`v32.3` release tag](https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/releases/tag/v32.3).

title: Events presence registration in app creates payment

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
### Describe the bug

Events presence registration in app creates payment

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Create an event with registrations
2. Register
3. Mark the registration as present _in the app_
You can simulate this by going to the registration using the API on `/v1/api/registrations/` and patching the body:
```
{
    "payment": "no_payment",
    "present": true
}
```
4. Note that a payment with the status 'no payment' is created for this registration

### Expected behaviour

No payment should be created

title: Fixed deleting of registration information fields
body:
Closes #1195 

### Summary
Event information fields couldn't be removed. This was because the backend was trying to order the information fields, including the ones which were marked to be deleted. This is fixed by making sure these fields don't get sorted.

### How to test
1. Create an event
2. Add a registration information field
3. Remove it again

### Additional context
Adding the following code before [line 218](https://github.com/svthalia/concrexit/blob/0c7132dde6937d2d78d5a344671cc14c348024ef/website/events/admin.py#L218) also seemed to fix it, although I prefer the implemented solution.
```python
for x in informationfield_forms:
    print(x)
```

title: Benefactors/honorary member statistics show wrong on statistics page

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
### Describe the bug
The statistics page has a graph showing the amount of benefactors and honorary members per cohort. However, the graph shows members that are currently a benefactor or a honorary member that had a membership (of any type) in a certain cohort.

For example, currently the graph tells us there are two benefactors and zero honorary members in the year 2017 (which I assume is academic 2017-2018). A lot more benefactors signed up that year and there was one (or two, depending on how you count) honorary member that year. 

### How to reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to the [statistics page](https://thalia.nu/members/statistics/)
2. Look at the graph called "Total number of (honary) members and benefactors per cohort" (sic).

### Expected behaviour
The graph should show how many memberships of a specific type (either benefactors or honorary memberships) started in each year.

title: Downloading albums fills up the disk

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
### Describe the bug
When a user wants to download an album, the website creates a zip file containing all photos (in `/tmp` of the Docker container). If multiple albums are downloaded, multiple large zip files are created. This very quickly fills up the disk.

We should remove this functionality to prevent this. It is not used often so that should not be a problem for members.

### Additional context
This has caused website outages a few times in the past.

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Be a user without an active memberships
2. Try to add a bank account via `/user/finance/accounts/add/`
3. Permission denied

### Expected behaviour
This should still be possible, since the fact that someone can authorize Thalia is not directly related to the fact that they are not a member right now. Even, when we would start using Thalia Pay for membership renewals, it is required that users that don't have an active membership can add their bank account.

### Screenshots

### Additional context

title: Don't show warning for cancellation while on waiting list
body:

<!--

Please add the appropriate label for the change that you made to this PR:
- feature: new feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
- bug: fix for the user, not a fix to a build script
- docs: changes to the documentation
- refactor: refactoring production code, eg. renaming a variable or rewriting a function

body:
In GitLab by @lukovdm on Dec 5, 2019, 15:28

### One-sentence description

When there is a guest registration for an event that has a price. If this person is marked as paid, an error occurs.

Associated sentry error: [https://sentry.io/organizations/thalia/issues/1372921592/?project=1463433&referrer=slack](https://sentry.io/organizations/thalia/issues/1372921592/?project=1463433)

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

1. Create an event with registrations and a price
2. Register a guest user for this event
3. Try to mark this guest user as paid
4. Breakage

### Expected behaviour

1. Create an event with registrations and a price

title: No loggers defined for any of our apps

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by @pingiun on Nov 3, 2019, 23:20

### One-sentence description

Anything that is logged by concrexit isn't saved anywhere, only exceptions seem to be logged, this could be due to sentry.

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

```python
import logging

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
logger.error("Module loaded")
```

I tried this in an urls.py because it's always loaded, and with production settings this message is not logged. This is because `LOGGING` in `settings/production.py` doesn't define a logger for e.g. `education.urls`.

This can be resolved by adding a root logger like so:
```python
'loggers': {
   'django': {
       'handlers': ['console', 'logfile'],
        'level': 'INFO',
    },
    '': {
       'handlers': ['console', 'logfile'],
       'level': 'INFO',
    }
},
```

This makes it so all messages that [propagate to the root logger](https://docs.python.org/3/howto/logging.html#logging-flow) and have at least log level INFO get logged to console and logfile.

### Expected behaviour

Useful log messages are logged by concrexit.

<!-- Please write how what happened did not meet your expectations -->

labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Aug 15, 2019, 18:04

### One-sentence description

Members can give references for registrations that start after their membership ends

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

1. Create a member with a membership that ends on 31-08-2019
2. Start a registration for the next lecture year (1 Sept)
3. Use the previously created member to create a reference
4. Works

### Expected behaviour

1. Create a member with a membership that ends on 31-08-2019
2. Start a registration for the next lecture year (1 Sept)
3. Use the previously created member to create a reference
4. Does not work

body:
In GitLab by ahoeks on Jun 4, 2019, 18:05

### One-sentence description

It looks like minutes is a required field if you set the 'Members only' checkbox to true.

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

When I want to make a General Meeting 'members only' I get the error that Minutes are a required field.

### Expected behaviour

I expect to be able to make changes to the information without having to upload minutes.

### Suggested solution

Set the `extra` field of the InlineModelAdmin to 0. https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/ref/contrib/admin/#django.contrib.admin.InlineModelAdmin.extra

This way the default minutes form will be hidden and a user will be required to add it manually.

body:
In GitLab by @JobDoesburg on Jun 2, 2019, 15:25

### One-sentence description

The warning text for unregistering after deadline is unclear

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

The current text suggests that the fine for unregistering is fixed (it says "the costs per person of € x,xx"). 

### Expected behaviour

The text should suggest that the exact amount will be determined later, and that the amount that is indicated is just an estimate. The terms and conditions are clear about this, but it would be nice to make the initial warning text just as clear.

title: Fitting 2000x430 images to 2000x430 does not work

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
In GitLab by nvoers on May 19, 2019, 19:04

/label ~bug ~"priority: medium"

### One-sentence description

Fitting 2000x430 images to 2000x430 does not work

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

1. Upload a 2000x430px slide to the website
2. Check the homepage for the slide
3. It does not load

### Expected behaviour

1. Upload a 2000x430px slide to the website
2. Check the homepage for the slide
3. It does load

### Upstream problem 

This is caused by a precision problem in Pillow. The `ImageOps.fit` method calculates a box to crop the image in.
Since the image is the same the calculation made is as follows:

```
>>> 2000/430 * 430
2000.0000000000002
```

This is then used `2000-(2000/430 * 430)` and the box has a left value that is negative causing an exception.

milestone.description:
##  :bookmark: concrexit v24

## Errors resolved
- Fix add send date to admin and fix cronjob (!1282) 
- Fix pizza api serializers and viewsets (!1278) ~"pizzas"
- Fix filter of events cards (!1276) ~"events"
- Give event notification default url of event (!1275) ~"events"
- Fix capitalisation of birthday field in registration form (!1274) ~"registrations"
- Fix event push notifications form redirect and field labels (!1271) ~"push notifications"
- Fix planned newsletters command (!1266) 
- Fix thabloids out-of-item rendering (!1261) ~"thabloid"
- Fix broken file validators (!1257) ~"documents" ~"thabloid"
- Fix saving pizza event if notification already exists (!1252) ~"pizzas"
- Fix newsletter event auto field filling for more than 11 events (!1251) ~"newsletter"
- Fix none birthday showing on profile (!1247) ~"members"
- Fix events payment status export in csv (!1246) ~"events"
- Fix order and showing of events cards (!1244) ~"events"
- Fix css class of older members tab (!1243) ~"members"
- Changed Event Terms (!1232) ~"events"
- Fix event url in description (!1231) ~"events"
- Base costs warning in newsletter only on the checkbox (!1229) ~"newsletter"
- Fix some small bugs in the automatic newsletter event code (!1228) ~"newsletter"
- Allow mixed ordering of items in newsletter (!1223) ~"newsletter"
- Fix organiser only decorator for registration views (!1222) 

## New functionality
- Add notification title+body to message data (!1279) ~"push notifications"
- Add sending of notification to participants of event by organisers (!1254) 
- Add ability for users to change their bank accounts (!1241) ~"payments"
- Add benefactors registration form and address autocomplete (!1236) ~"registrations"
- Automatically populate newsletter agenda using events package (!1227) ~"newsletter"
- Add FileHandler for django logging (!1226) ~"server"
- Added Organiser to Events Page (!1215) 
- Resolve "Automatic notification after uploading a new photo album" (!1211) ~"photos" ~"push notifications"
- Add newsletter planning feature (!1206) ~"newsletter"
- Add command to minimise registrations data (!1203) ~"registrations"

## Technical changes
- Update dependency sentry-sdk to ~0.9.0 (!1281) 
- Start uwsgi with `exec` so it receives signals correctly (!1277) 
- Fix naive datetime runtime error (!1268) ~"registrations"
- Fix double occurances of emails in mailinglists (!1264) ~"mailinglists"
- Refactor and remove thaliawebsite views (!1255) ~"refactor"
- Remove obsolete pizza views and fix redirects (!1253) ~"refactor"
- Remove django-cors-headers (!1249) ~"refactor"
- Change newsletter automatic agenda range to 2 weeks instead of 1 (!1245) ~"newsletter"
- Split profile form in 2 to make it easier to edit (!1242) ~"members"
- Replace print with self.stdout.write in management (!1234) 
- Do not require events api authentication for open data (!1230) ~"events"
- Move pizza admin to backend and migrate to payments app for payment registration (!1225) ~"payments" ~"pizzas"
- Update to Django 2.2 (!1224) 
- Change notification address domains (!1212) 
- Update dependency sentry-sdk to ~0.8.0 (!1262) 
- Update dependency factory_boy to ~2.12 (!1250) 
- Update dependency sphinx to v2 (!1240) 
- Update dependency Pillow to v6 (!1239) 
- Update dependency firebase-admin to ~2.16 (!1238) 
- Change schedule to always except for Wednesday evening (!1237) 
- Update poetry dependencies (!1235) 
- Configure Renovate (!1210)

title: Use correct language attribute in html tag

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
In GitLab by @pingiun on Mar 4, 2019, 15:45

<!--
    This template is for changes that do not affect the behaviour of the website.

    ** If you are not in the Technicie, there is a very high chance that you
       should not use this template

    Examples:

     * Changes in CI
     * Refactoring of code
     * Technicie-facing documentation
-->

### One-sentence description
The `lang` attribute of the root html element is hardcoded to "en", this can be set to the LANGUAGE_CODE
<!-- Please provide a brief description of the issue. Don't go into specifics. -->

### Why?
The [specification recommends it](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/lang#Specifications).
<!-- Please motivate why we should invest into this change -->

### Current implementation
The value is hardcoded to `"en"`
<!-- If relevant, describe how it's done currently -->

### Suggested implementation
Set the lang attribute to the current language code
<!-- Provide (a) suggestion(s) for how we could approach this -->

title: Change registrations without registration change permission

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: Must be dealt with before the next release is deployed.

body:
In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Feb 10, 2019, 17:44

### One-sentence description

Change registrations without registration change permission

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

1. Open a registration via the API your user should not have edit permissions for because you don't have registration change permissions
2. Edit it
3. Value is saved

### Expected behaviour

No editing if you don't have registration change permission 

In practice everyone with event change permission also has registration change permission. So this isn't such a large problem.

---
From Slack:

Gijs Hendriksen [22:16]
Hmm, ik zie nu dat `is_organiser` voor events de permission `events.change_event` checkt. Alleen wordt de `is_organiser` functie ook gebruikt om te checken of een registration aangepast mag worden, waardoor `events.change_registration` niet gebruikt wordt. Lijkt me niet helemaal de bedoeling toch?
In principe gebeurt het volgens mij nooit dat iemand wel het event aan mag passen maar niet de registrations, maar miss toch handig om daar ff iets mee te doen?

Sébastiaan Versteeg [22:21]
Als het goed is hebben we daar laatst naar gekeken
Waar gaat het fout denk je?

Gijs Hendriksen [22:23]
Misschien dat het alleen nog maar in de API fout gaat hoor, kan ook
Maar `is_organiser` wordt gebruikt om te bepalen of een user bijv. registrations kan aanpassen, maar in dat proces wordt de permission `events.change_registration` niet gecheckt

Sébastiaan Versteeg [22:28]
ja dat klopt, dat komt omdat de admin die zelf sowieso checkt
dat is wel een goed punt
ik denk dat je gelijk hebt en iedereen met event permission nu registrations kan aanpassen

title: Dates entered in newsletter cannot handle NL -> EN

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by ahoeks on Jan 30, 2019, 19:24

### One-sentence description

Dutch dateformat cannot switch to English

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

When making the newsletter, dates are entered, during in-between saving the language the site is in changes. If the language (in another tab) changes from English to Dutch, the format the dates are in is changed accordingly. The other way around, from Dutch date format to English, does not work. The newsletter cannot change them and sees them as invalid

1. Enter a date
2. Change language from Dutch to English
3. Invalid date

### Expected behaviour

I expected the date to change back to the English format, or not to change at all, or maybe that both get accepted.

In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Dec 10, 2018, 16:16

### One-sentence description

Thabloid filtering keeps items that should be hidden

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

1. Go to the Thabloid page
2. Filter on a year
3. Notice that all the whitespace

### Expected behaviour

No whitespace, nice grid.

### Solution

The `col` items for the grid are not connected to the filter plugin, the content is hidden but the container is not resulting in the visible whitespace.

title: Event price can change after registration start

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Nov 29, 2018, 18:23

### One-sentence description

Event price can change after registration start

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug

1. I register for an event accepting the costs etc
2. The costs change
3. I pay more than what I accepted
4. I'm angry :angry: 
5. Problems

### Expected behaviour

Event prices cannot change after registration start!

---

This is also important for #632, since payments are made using the price in the event and if the price changes the payments cannot reflect that.

body:
In GitLab by @joren485 on Nov 26, 2018, 11:15

### One-sentence description

<!-- What breaks -->

Always set `rel="noopener"` with `target = "_blank"` for external domains.

### Why

<!-- Please write what is happening and how we could reproduce it, if relevant -->

<!--
1. Step 1
2. Step 2
3. ???
4. Breakage
-->

Using `target="_blank"` without `rel="noopener"` for external domains is a security vulnerability.
* [source](https://www.tutorialdocs.com/article/html-opener-blank.html)
* [source](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/noopener)

### Expected behaviour

<!-- Please write how what happened did not meet your expectations -->

`a` tags containing `target="_blank"` should also contain `rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow"`.

    This template is for changes that do not affect the behaviour of the website.

    Examples:

     * Changes in CI
     * Refactoring of code

-->

### One-sentence description
The current way of displaying members when you select all members, is by showing them on cohort order, while this should change to alphabetical order.
<!-- Please provide a brief description of the issue. Don't go into specifics. -->

### Why?
It is more clear when it is sorted on alphabetical order, instead of first sorted on Cohort order and then alphabetical order.
<!-- Please motivate why we should invest into this change -->

### Current implementation
Currently, it is sorted on Cohort order, and then Alphabetical order, when selecting 'all members'.
https://thalia.nu/members/
<!-- If relevant, describe how it's done currently -->

### Suggested implementation
When selecting 'all members', it should be sorted Alphabetically immediately.
<!-- Provide (a) suggestion(s) for how we could approach this -->

In GitLab by @gijshendriksen on Oct 24, 2018, 19:35

### One-sentence description
In the (Dutch) email sent to the first person on the waiting list when someone cancels their registration, the registration date is empty, resulting in the message "Je hebt je op  aangemeld voor...".

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug
1. Be the first on the waiting list for a certain event.
2. Trick someone into cancelling their registration so you can go to the event.

The registration date is not empty.

title: Translation for 'show only nicknames' is incorrect

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by bzandt on Oct 24, 2018, 19:30

### One-sentence description
If a user selects 'only initials' as their display name this displays their nickname. When editing a user in admin selecting 'only initials' and not filling out the nickname produces an error.

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug 1
1. Select 'initials only' as display name in admin
2. Delete the nickname
3. Try to save the user
4. This produces the error that a nickname should be entered

### Current behaviour / Reproducing the bug 2
1. Select 'initials only' as display name in admin
2. Go to profile page
3. Only your nickname is displayed

### Expected behaviour
1. Select 'initials only' as display name in admin
2. Delete nickname but enter something for the initials
3. Try to save the user
4. This should work

### Expected behaviour 2
1. Select 'initials only' as display name
2. Go to profile page
3. Only initials should be displayed

In GitLab by @JobDoesburg on Oct 22, 2018, 18:10

<!--
    This template is for changes that do not affect the behaviour of the website.

    Examples:

     * Changes in CI
     * Refactoring of code
     * Technicie-facing documentation
-->

### One-sentence description

Automatically convert student numbers to correct capitalization

### Why?

Especially on mobile devices, when entering a student number in the registration form, it starts with an capital S while only a small letter s is accepted (or the other way around, sorry I don't know). It would be nice to just accept both and convert it automatically. Same for people just entering a 7-digit number without prefix s. 


### Current implementation

Only certain capitalization is accepted.

### Suggested implementation

Accept all CaPiTaliZatIoN and convert it automatically to a specific format.

### One-sentence description
The 'approve' button on the renewals page is dead

### Current behaviour
When hitting the 'approve' button, nothing happens and the page deadlocks. When doing it from the renewals overview (selecting and action via the dropdown menu) everything works fine luckily.

A working button the renewal.

title: Empty board and committee pages not consistent

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
In GitLab by @joren485 on Oct 2, 2018, 17:21

### One-sentence description
Going to the board page without any boards is not handled the same as going to the committee page without any committees.

### Current behaviour
If there are no boards, going to the board page results in a 404 page because of an error (`No Board matches the given query.`). Going to the committee page without any committees however shows a nice message "There are no committees!".

Looking at [the template for the board page](https://gitlab.science.ru.nl/thalia/concrexit/blob/master/website/activemembers/templates/activemembers/board_index.html#L57) it looks like a similar message should be shown:
```
          {% empty %}
          {% trans 'There are no boards!' %}
          {% endfor %}
```

### Expected behaviour
If there are no boards, going to the board page results in `There are no boards!`.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to the boards page without any boards.

title: Registration with same username causes problems on payment process

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Jul 12, 2018, 10:57

### One-sentence description

Registration with same username causes problems on payment process

### Current behaviour

If two registrations exist with the same entered/generated username and the first is fully processed while the second is in the accepted stage the payment for that second registration will not be able to fully succeed since the username is taken. However, the payment is marked processed. Thus the registration will be in limbo, forever.

### Expected behaviour

No limbo!

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create two registrations with the same first and last name
2. Accept them both
3. Process payment for 1
4. Try to process payment for 2
5. Erreur! :boom:

title: Escape commas in address label csv export

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
In GitLab by @gijshendriksen on Jul 11, 2018, 14:21

### One-sentence description
Addresses containing a comma are not surrounded with quotes in the csv export, meaning they are split into multiple columns.

### Current behaviour
When exporting addresses for users, some of these addresses contain commas, like _"Mercator I, room ..."_. In csv, these commas are seen as separator, meaning these addresses are split into several columns. They should be contained in a single column.

### Expected behaviour
Commas are escaped correctly, by surrounding the corresponding fields in quotes during the export.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add an address field containing a comma for a certain member.
2. Export the address labels csv file.
3. Notice the address field is separated into two columns.

In GitLab by @gijshendriksen on Jul 2, 2018, 17:31

### One-sentence description
Ordering in the events backend should be chronological when sorting based on a datetime field.

### Current behaviour
When ordering on the "Registration start" field, for example, the registrations are sorted lexicographically, as can be seen in this screenshot:

![registration_ordering](https://gitlab.science.ru.nl//thalia/concrexit/uploads/7f59f8d57f8b74e0d12ded2f867cca01/registration_ordering.png)

### Expected behaviour
When ordering on a datetime field, the registrations should be ordered chronologically.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create registrations for June 2nd and July 1st for a certain event.
2. Go to the admin page for that specific event.
2. Notice that the registration in July is shown before the registration in June.

### One-sentence description
Running `celery` worker as `root` is not recommended.

When using the `docker-compose.yml` file, the following warning is shown:
```
celery_1    | /usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/celery/platforms.py:796: RuntimeWarning: You're running the worker with superuser privileges: this is
celery_1    | absolutely not recommended!
```

### Expected behaviour
The `celery` worker is not run as `root` (and the warning is not shown).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run `docker-compose up`.

title: Registration tests broken with regards to 'upgrades'
body:
In GitLab by @thomwiggers on Jan 2, 2018, 17:13

### One-sentence description

The upgrade tests are broken due to poor date handling.

### Current behaviour

Broken build.

### Expected behaviour

Build works.

### Steps to reproduce

1. `./manage.py test`

### Suggested solution

Instead of mocking dates which is horribly complicated, use `freezegun` to fix dates in a more reliable and readable way:

```python
from freezegun import freeze_time

def test():
    assert datetime.datetime.now() != datetime.datetime(2012, 1, 14)
    with freeze_time("2012-01-14"):
        assert datetime.datetime.now() == datetime.datetime(2012, 1, 14)
    assert datetime.datetime.now() != datetime.datetime(2012, 1, 14)
```

title: Hide association documents when unavailable

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Oct 30, 2017, 08:59

### One-sentence description

The year report of 16-17 is showing, but there is no file to back it. This results in an error when someone tries to access it.

### Current behaviour

The year report of 16-17 is showing, but there is no file to back it. This results in an error when someone tries to access it.

### Expected behaviour

There should not be an icon if there is no year report yet. It should be possible not to have reports. Note that it's a filefield, so setting `null=True` [won't do much](https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/10244); `blank=True` should be enough to work with.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to the documents pgae
2. Try to view the '16-'17 year report.

title: Directly linking to vacancies is broken

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Oct 23, 2017, 09:53

### One-sentence description

When clicking a vacancy and copy-pasting the link, the resulting page does not show the actual vacancy.

### Current behaviour

Copy-pasting a link to a vacancy causes you to navigate to a seemingly random part of the page. This is probably due to the Javascript loading quite late. I realize this is perhaps non-trivial to fix, but that's Javascript for you.

### Expected behaviour

Copy-pasting a link to a vacancy causes you to navigate to the correct uncollapsed vacancy. Perhaps this can be more easily achieved by passing a server-sided CSS class when a page with an anchor is requested.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to e.g. https://thalia.nu/career/vacancies#vacancy-41
2. Land randomly on the page rather than seeing the correct uncollapsed vacancy

body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Sep 19, 2017, 11:19

### One-sentence description

On a committee page, the 'member since' date should ignore small gaps of 1 day in membership history, since these are typically administration errors.

See e.g. @lscholten's Technicie membership.

### Current behaviour

When a member has a 1-day gap (member from t to t+x, chair from t+x+1 to now), the join date is reset to the new membership's starting date (i.e. t+x+1).

### Expected behaviour

When a member has a 1-day gap (member from t to t+x, chair from t+x+1 to now), the join date should be the original join date (i.e. t).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a membership from t to t+2years
2. Create a membership from t+2years+1day to now
3. Observe that 'committee member since' says 't+2years', not 't'

body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Sep 10, 2017, 13:28

In #484, it became apparent that Registration objects were expected to be recreated, but are currently being re-used (https://gitlab.science.ru.nl/thalia/concrexit/issues/484#note_34876). We should look into this, and make it consistent.

Creating new registration objects when people re-register creates a more accurate timeline, but it may make things a bit harder to understand when someone occurs as both cancelled and registered (in that case, should we omit the cancelled registration from the view?).

title: Populate mentor mailinglist with this year's mentors rather than last year's
body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Sep 10, 2017, 13:19

In !545, a list for mentors is created. However, it's populated with last year's set of mentors. Perhaps converting an offset datetime to a lecture year (e.g. +9 months, to transition on January 1st rather than September 1st?) would be an easy solution.

As of writing, this is an unreleased feature, so it's not a bug in production right now.

title: Finding members by hidden nickname should not happen

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Should be dealt with when nothing else remains.

body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Aug 16, 2017, 20:41

### One-sentence description

Finding members by hidden nickname should not happen

### Current behaviour

If a user has a nickname but has display options set to hide it, they still appear in search results that match the nickname. This can lead to confusion.

### Expected behaviour

When a user does not display their nickname as part of their display name, it should not be possible to find them based on their nickname.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Give yourself a nickname (preferably something unique)
2. Set your name preference to not display the nickname
3. Search by keyword for your nickname

title: Invalid attempts at new users are already sent an email

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

labels.name: chore
labels.description: Something that is not a bug or a feature, does not change production behaviour

body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Aug 16, 2017, 20:19

### One-sentence description

Invalid attempts at new users are already sent an email when one attempts to add them using the admin forms.

### Current behaviour

Adding a user that triggers validation errors also triggers outgoing emails. This means that emails to one new user can be sent multiple times. Perhaps other things also happen.

### Expected behaviour

Nothing should change when the form is considered invalid.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new user
2. Mess up one input field (when testing, I forgot to add a number in the first address line)
3. Observe an outgoing email (e.g. when running in development mode, as output of `manage.py`)

title: Cannot fill in event fields when registering
body:
In GitLab by @lscholten on Jun 28, 2017, 21:25

Introduced in !477
### One-sentence description
Cannot fill in event fields when registering for an event with registration fields.

### Current behaviour
When you register for an event with fields, you must fill in the fields and press submit.
This does not save the fields, but you are registered.

### Expected behaviour
The fields are saved and you are registered.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to an event with fields
2. Make sure you are not registered
3. Press the register button, your registration should be submitted
4. Fill in the required fields
5. Get redirected to the events page, with the error "you were already registered"
6. Press 'update registration'
7. See that your submitted fields have not been saved

title: Documents: 2011-2012 is not directly reachable

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A new feature or a bugfix that is non-critical.

body:
In GitLab by gmulder on Jun 27, 2017, 01:21

### One-sentence description
The documents page should switch to the year 2011-2012 when it is selected from the drop-down box.

### Current behaviour
The documents page does not switch to the year 2011-2012 when it is selected from the drop-down box.

### Expected behaviour
The documents page switches to the year 2011-2012 when it is selected from the drop-down box.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Log in
2. Go to the `/documents/` page (e.g. Association -> Documents).
3. Navigate to "General meetings"
4. Click on `2011-2012` (a dropdown box appears)
5. Click on `2011-2012` in the dropdown box
6. Nothing happens.

Alternatively, replace step 5 by clicking on another item (e.g. `2010-2011`) and then execute the original step 4 and 5 again. In that case, step 6 is replaced by the expected behaviour.

Note: the period (i.e. `2011-2012`) is relative to the current period. When we switch to the next year, this period will be `2012-2013`.

In GitLab by @gijshendriksen on Jun 16, 2017, 22:10

### One-sentence description
When searching for `firstname lastname`, for example, only members with a first name, last name, nickname or username containg exactly the phrase `firstname lastname` are shown.

### Current behaviour
When using multiple keywords in a search query for a member, the `index` view does not split these keywords. Thus, it only shows members with a field (first name, last name, nickname or username) containing all of the keywords.

See, for example:  
![search_members](https://gitlab.science.ru.nl//thalia/concrexit/uploads/34d908266ee7e38725af1ebc709383dc/search_members.png)

### Expected behaviour
The search function returns members where each of the keywords is in one of the model's fields.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to https://thalia.nu/members/
2. Enter multiple keywords that do not belong to the same model field, for example `firstname lastname`.
3. Hit the `search button`.

title: Off-by-one in `_send_queue_mail(event)`
body:
In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Jun 12, 2017, 15:29

### One-sentence description

Off-by-one in `_send_queue_mail(event)`

### Current behaviour

We sturen nu een mailtje naar de persoon die na het cancellen als eerste in de wachtrij staat, maar we moeten een mailtje sturen naar de persoon die voor het cancellen als eerste in de wachtrij staat.

### Expected behaviour

We moeten een mailtje sturen naar de persoon die voor het cancellen als eerste in de wachtrij staat.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create event, add registrations
2. Cancel registration in frontend

### How to fix

In `_registration_cancel` moeten we eerst `_send_queue_mail(event)` doen, en dan pas de `reg.date_cancelled` op `timezone.now()` zetten.

title: Send queue mail wordt verzonden als iemand op de wachtrij zich afmeldt
body:
In GitLab by smooren on Jun 12, 2017, 14:42

### One-sentence description
Send queue mail wordt verzonden als iemand op de wachtrij zich afmeldt


### Current behaviour
Als iemand in de wachtrij zichzelf er vanaf haalt wordt `_send_queue_mail` nog steeds uitgevoerd

### Expected behaviour

Als iemand in de wachtrij zichzelf er vanaf haalt wordt er geen mail verstuurd

### Steps to reproduce

1. Maak een event met max participants
2. Voeg aantal registrations toe
3. Cancel registration in de frontend van een van de gebruikers
4. Zie verzonden mail

### Original text

Je krijgt een mail dat je in de wachtlijst stond maar nu mag gaan. Als je vervolgens naar de link gaat die in de mail staat sta je nog steeds in de wachtrij. Wat moet ik nu geloven.

title: Events without organisers break
body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Mar 30, 2017, 14:17

Gerelateerd aan #357 en !418. Als je event geen organiser heeft (wat waarschijnlijk alleen voor komt bij gemigreerde events uit concrete5) wordt er een `.pk` van een `None` bekeken, en dat gaat stuk. Twee opties: ofwel even met de hand een organiser aanklikken bij alle oude events (dit heeft denk ik mijn voorkeur omdat het het verplicht zijn van een organiser handhaaft, maar is wat moeite), ofwel geen permissions checken als er geen organiser is. In dat laatste geval is dit een hotfix waard.

title: Checking documents before accepting in education app is not possible
body:
In GitLab by @se-bastiaan on Jan 18, 2017, 23:14

Let's assume someone just uploaded an exam or summary and I'm a member of the educacie.
I want to check whether or not the uploaded file is correct and should be accepted thus I click on the file in the edit form.
Oh noes!!11!!: 404 page not found! What do I do now? I'm unable to verify the file and thus I shall have to accept it and download it from the corresponding course page to see if it's ok. If it's not I'll have to delete it by going back to the admin again. Horrible!
<hr>
As you might imagine this is not what we want. We should have a way for the educacie to check files before accepting them. Either by exposing the direct url to they who are a member of the committee and/or by adding a special field to the edit form that shows the real link which can be used instead.

title: .dockerignore not used properly in `docker-compose`
body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Nov 6, 2016, 13:43

It appears there is a difference between how `docker build` and `docker-compose up` treat `.dockerignore`. It is related to upstream issues such as https://github.com/docker/compose/issues/1607, and is not something we can immediately fix. However, this does mean we need to pay some attention to this when building images, especially ones we're pushing to public places.

Because of this, the build context is larger than necessary in directories that include e.g. `.tox` and `.git`, as well as large files in `website/media/`. Additionally, any files in `website/media/` added to the image, increasing its size unnecessarily. More importantly, we should be careful not to leak any secrets (or private data of members!) by including `db.sqlite3` or `localsettings.py` files.

Perhaps we can work around some of the issues by editing `.dockerignore`.

title: Zoeken in /members gooit exception als iemand NULL als nickname heeft

milestone.title: Launch
milestone.description:
In this milestone, we track everything that's between us and replacing the current website with all its features.
This also contains all data migrations.

body:
In GitLab by @pingiun on Oct 1, 2016, 18:32

Search zoekt in de database op first_name, last_name, username en nickname. Nicknames zijn echter niet verplicht, dus de lijn `keywords in obj.nickname.lower() or` werkt niet als iemand NULL heeft als username. 

In een echt scenario zullen mensen '' hebben als nickname en niet NULL, maar geautomatiseerde tools (zoals createfixtures) zetten lege velden op NULL.

Informatie over de exception:
```
Exception Type: 	AttributeError
Exception Value: 	

'NoneType' object has no attribute 'lower'

Exception Location: 	/home/pingiun/Documents/jbconcrexit/website/members/views.py in <listcomp>, line 55
```
De lijnen waar het om gaat:
```python
53 if keywords:
54         members = [obj for obj in members if
55                    keywords in obj.nickname.lower() or
56                    keywords in obj.user.first_name.lower() or
57                    keywords in obj.user.last_name.lower() or
58                    keywords in obj.user.username.lower()]
```

title: `static/COMPILED` wordt niet vanzelf gemaakt
body:
In GitLab by @joostrijneveld on Jul 14, 2016, 23:03

Sinds we LESS willen compilen moet de map `static/COMPILED` (blijkbaar) bestaan, anders loop je tegen deze fout aan:

```
StaticCompilationError at /
Error: ENOENT, no such file or directory 'concrexit/website/static/COMPILED/css'
```

Kunnen we niet checken of die map bestaat wanneer je opstart, en 'm aanmaken als dat nog niet zo is? Dat zou bijvoorbeeld eenvoudig in de algemene site-app kunnen, in de [`AppConfig.ready()`](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/applications/#django.apps.AppConfig.ready)..

Maar @thomwiggers en @lscholten hebben hier gister tijd aan besteed, dus misschien gedachten hierover voordat ik 't probeer te fixen? Liepen jullie hier niet tegenaan? Moest je met de hand `mkdir static/COMPILED` uitvoeren?
